qas.question: Who plays an influential role in the formation of party policy?
In what role are the floor leader's instrumental for legislation?

answers.text: guiding legislation favored by his party through the House, or in resisting those programs of the other party that are considered undesirable by his own party

qas.question: How are floor leaders kept informed of legislative status?

answers.text: contacts with his party's members serving on House committees, and with the members of the party's whip organization

qas.question: What does the whip organization play a role in forming in conjunction with party leaders?

plausible_answers.text: programs of the other party that are considered undesirable

qas.question: What programs are resisted by the whip organization?
What does the whip organization devise and implement for the party?
What is the whip organization kept constantly informed about?
What committees does the whip organization oversee?

context: <a0_0>A party's floor leader<a0_0/>, in conjunction with other party leaders, plays an influential role in the formulation of <b3_0>party policy and programs<b3_0/>. He is instrumental in <a1_0>guiding legislation favored by his party through the House, or in resisting those <b4_0>programs of the other party that are considered undesirable<b4_0/> by his own party<a1_0/>. He is instrumental in devising and implementing his party's <b5_0>strategy<b5_0/> on the floor with respect to promoting or opposing legislation. He is kept constantly informed as to <b6_0>the status of legislative business<b6_0/> and as to the sentiment of his party respecting particular legislation under consideration. Such information is derived in part from the floor leader's <a2_0>contacts with his party's members serving on <b7_0>House committees<b7_0/>, and with the members of the party's whip organization<a2_0/>.
